text:
Hey, everyone.
I'm Ruby Rose Turner.
And I'm Kyliegh Curran.

We're at Disney
California Adventure Park

at their latest seasonal
foodie festival.

Ruby: And we're here
at Downtown Disney District

celebrating Earth Day
with our friends
from National Geographic.

There's so much to see
and do here for Earth Day

including food
from around the Earth,

even cooking demonstrations
from Nat Geo.
This is amazing.

- Isn't it good?
- What?

- Both: And this is...
- Kristen Kish from

"Restaurants At
The End Of The World."
I'm headed out on a journey

to places like this,
this, and this.

Kyliegh: I love "Restaurants
At The End Of The World."

- Was it fun shooting?
- I'm incredibly proud
of what we've put out there.
For a week at a time,

I'm spending true actual time
with these people,

sun up to sun down,
learning who they are,

which I feel like
just adds so much value
to the final product on TV.

What does Earth Day
mean to you?

It's really nice to have
this concentrated day

where everyone
is collectively saying

we're going to pay
attention to this more,

we're going to learn more,
we're going to educate

ourselves
and those around us.

How important is food
around the world
in the context of Earth Day?

I mean, all of our food
comes from the Earth.

- Yeah. True.
- We need a healthy Earth.

We need a healthy environment
for things to thrive.

Because ultimately what
then we consume from there

- becomes part of us. 
- How does it feel being

- at the foodie festival today?
- I love it.

Anytime you're surrounded
with people that share

the same joy
and passion you have,

and also people that
just appreciate what you do,

- that's always really nice.
- Yeah.
And check this out!

These amazing
elephant sculptures

created to celebrate
the new Nat Geo series
"Secrets Of The Elephants."

Kyliegh: Artists from Kenya
hand-carved these

upcycled from
discarded flip-flops

- found on Kenyan shores.
- And put together

this one of a kind creation
to celebrate the beauty

of elephants
all around the world.

- ( trumpeting )
- "Secrets Of The Elephants"

travels the world to take you
inside the extraordinary lives

of different families
of elephants

and highlights how similar
they are to people, too.

Our family is like
an elephant family because

we always like
to stay together as a herd.

I like that they take care
of each other,

and they have a very,
very strong community.

National Geographic takes us
to places around the world

that we don't normally
get a chance to see.

This show is definitely
raising awareness.

At the end of the day,
there's always more

- that we can do.
- Wow!
We had a lot to explore today

and that's what Nat Geo
is all about.

You can watch "Secrets
Of The Elephants"
and more on Disney Plus.
Both: See ya!
